intro: Alsine linnaei, commonly known as the Linnaean alsike, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Alsine linnaei is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and soil stabilization.
